definitions.meaning: 推迟或延迟某事的发生
definitions.usage: 指将某事推迟到晚些时候，通常用于计划、事件或行动的延迟。

examples.scene: 公司原计划下周召开新产品发布会，但由于技术问题，发布会需要推迟。
examples.chineseIdea: 推迟新产品发布的时间，让团队有更多时间完善产品。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Due to technical issues, we had to @ @ @ until next month.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Due to technical issues, we had to 「delay the launch」 until next month.
examples.chineseTranslation: 由于技术问题，我们不得不将「发布会推迟」到下个月。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'We put off to launch the product.' 纠正：'We had to delay the launch of the product.'

examples.scene: 项目经理在团队会议上发现准备工作不足，决定推迟重要决定。
examples.chineseIdea: 推迟做出决定，以便收集更多信息。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The manager decided to @ @ @ until more data was available.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The manager decided to 「delay a decision」 until more data was available.
examples.chineseTranslation: 经理决定将「决定推迟」直到获得更多数据。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'We delay to decide.' 纠正：'We decided to delay the decision.'

definitions.meaning: 使某人或某事晚点或延误
definitions.usage: 指因外部因素导致某人或某事晚于预期时间到达或完成，通常用于交通、行程或任务。

examples.scene: 机场因暴风雨天气，导致多架航班无法按时起飞。
examples.chineseIdea: 由于天气原因，航班晚点，乘客需要等待。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The storm caused the airline to @ @ @ for several hours.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The storm caused the airline to 「delay a flight」 for several hours.
examples.chineseTranslation: 暴风雨导致航空公司将「航班延误」了几个小时。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The flight was delayed by storm.' 纠正：'The storm caused the flight to be delayed.'

examples.scene: 网购的包裹因物流问题未能按时送达，客户感到不满。
examples.chineseIdea: 物流延误导致包裹送货时间推迟。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Logistics issues caused the company to @ @ @ of the package.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Logistics issues caused the company to 「delay the delivery」 of the package.
examples.chineseTranslation: 物流问题导致公司将「包裹送货延误」。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'The delivery was late because of logistics.' 纠正：'Logistics issues caused the delivery to be delayed.'
